name: Anti-Inflammatory Breakfast Smoothie
explanation: This mango green smoothie gets bright tart flavor from frozen passion fruit, and inflammation-fighting benefits from fresh kale. Dates add natural sweetness without added sugar. While cilantro may not be a typical smoothie ingredient, we love the herbal notes it adds to this smoothie. Feel free to leave it out if that's not your thing—it's just as delicious without.

ingredients.text: 4 cups kale, stemmed and roughly chopped
2 cups frozen mango chunks, thawed slightly (see Tip)
1 cup frozen unsweetened seedless passion fruit cubes

direction.text: Add kale, mango, passion fruit, yogurt, water, dates and cilantro (if using) to a blender. Blend on medium-low speed, adjusting speed as necessary, until well combined and creamy.

name: Blackberry Smoothie
explanation: This blackberry smoothie has plenty of fresh berry flavor and sweetness from banana and honey. And with only 5 minutes from start to finish, it's the perfect breakfast for busy mornings. If fresh blackberries aren't available, feel free to use frozen in this easy and healthy smoothie.

ingredients.text: ½ cup plain whole-milk Greek yogurt

direction.text: Combine blackberries, banana, yogurt, honey, lemon juice and ginger in a blender. Cover and process until completely smooth, about 2 minutes. Serve immediately.

name: Mango-Passion Fruit Smoothie
explanation: Tangy passion fruit pairs well with mango in this tropical-flavored smoothie.

ingredients.text: 1 ripe mango, peeled and diced (1 cup)
1/3-1/2 cup frozen passion fruit juice concentrate

direction.text: Combine mango, yogurt, 1/3 cup juice concentrate, water and crushed ice in a blender; cover and blend until smooth and frothy. Add more concentrate, if desired. Serve immediately.

name: Anti-Inflammatory Beet Smoothie
explanation: This vibrant beet smoothie combines sweet and earthy beets with berries, banana and orange juice for a well-balanced flavor. Look for packaged cooked beets where the prepared fruits and vegetables are sold. Beets are high in belatins, an antioxidant that may help decrease inflammation in the body. Other nutrient-packed ingredients add even more anti-inflammatory power, like the anthocyanins in blueberries and the gingerol found in ginger.

ingredients.text: 1 (8.8-ounce) package refrigerated cooked beets (such as Love Beets)
1 (1/2 inch) piece fresh ginger, peeled and grated

direction.text: Combine strawberries, blueberries, orange juice, beets, banana, carrot and ginger in a blender; process until combined, about 30 seconds. Divide between 2 glasses. Serve immediately.

name: Golden Milk Frappe
explanation: This frappe harnesses the flavor power of a turmeric spice mixture for a cool treat. The golden-milk spice mix is combined with kefir, coconut milk and honey before being whirred together for a frothy delight.

ingredients.text: ½ cup canned light coconut milk

direction.text: Combine kefir, coconut milk, honey, turmeric, cinnamon, pepper and ice cubes in a blender. Blend until smooth and frothy.

name: Apple-Peanut Butter Smoothie
explanation: Apples and peanut butter are a classic pair. Try them blended together in this healthy smoothie recipe.

direction.text: Combine almond milk, apple, peanut butter, honey (if using), vanilla, cinnamon and ice cubes in a blender. Puree until smooth.

name: Really Green Smoothie
explanation: The combination of kale and avocado makes this healthy smoothie recipe extra green. Chia seeds lend a heart-healthy punch of fiber and omega-3 fatty acids.

ingredients.text: 1 cup packed baby kale or coarsely chopped mature kale

direction.text: Combine banana, kale, almond milk, avocado, chia seeds and honey in a blender. Blend on high until creamy and smooth. Add ice and blend until smooth.

name: Strawberry-Pineapple Smoothie
explanation: Blend almond milk, strawberry and pineapple for a smoothie that's so easy you can make it on busy mornings. A bit of almond butter adds richness and filling protein. Freeze some of the almond milk for an extra-icy texture.

ingredients.text: ¾ cup chilled unsweetened almond milk, plus more if needed

direction.text: Combine strawberries, pineapple, almond milk and almond butter in a blender. Process until smooth, adding more almond milk, if needed, for desired consistency. Serve immediately.

name: Chocolate-Peanut Butter Protein Shake
explanation: This creamy high-protein shake will keep you satisfied for hours and tastes like a chocolate-peanut butter banana milkshake. You don't even need to add protein powder, thanks to the naturally occurring protein in the soymilk, Greek yogurt and peanut butter.

ingredients.text: ½ cup reduced-fat plain Greek yogurt

direction.text: Combine soymilk, banana, yogurt, cocoa powder and peanut butter in a blender; blend until smooth.

name: Pineapple Green Smoothie
explanation: Use ripe bananas for this creamy Greek yogurt, spinach and pineapple smoothie. Chia seeds add healthy omega-3 fats, fiber and a little protein for an extra nutritional boost.

ingredients.text: ⅓ cup nonfat plain Greek yogurt
1 cup frozen banana slices (about 1 medium banana)
1-2 teaspoons pure maple syrup or honey (optional)

direction.text: Add almond milk and yogurt to a blender, then add spinach, banana, pineapple, chia seeds and sweetener (if using); blend until smooth.

name: Berry-Kefir Smoothie
explanation: Get a probiotic boost at breakfast when you add kefir to your smoothie. Feel free to use any berries and nut butter you have on hand in this healthy smoothie recipe.

direction.text: Combine berries, kefir, banana, almond butter and vanilla in a blender. Blend until smooth.

name: Strawberry-Blueberry-Banana Smoothie
explanation: A smoothie with strawberries, blueberries and banana is delicately sweet and entirely kid-friendly, even with a boost of protein from hemp seeds. Freeze the fruits ahead of time for an extra frosty texture once blended.

ingredients.text: ¾ cup chilled unsweetened cashew milk, plus more if needed

direction.text: Combine strawberries, blueberries, banana, cashew milk, cashew butter and hemp seeds in a blender. Process until smooth, adding more cashew milk, if needed, for desired consistency. Serve immediately.

name: Spinach-Avocado Smoothie
explanation: This healthy green smoothie gets super creamy from the frozen banana and avocado. Make ahead (up to 1 day) and store it in the fridge until you need a veggie boost.

direction.text: Combine yogurt, spinach, banana, avocado, water and honey in a blender. Puree until smooth.

name: Strawberry-Chocolate Smoothie
explanation: This creamy, rich strawberry-chocolate smoothie will satisfy any chocolate cravings. It's so decadent you might want it as a dessert, too.

ingredients.text: 1 cup chilled unsweetened chocolate almond milk, plus more if needed

direction.text: Combine strawberries, almond milk, almond butter, cocoa and honey in a blender. Process until smooth, adding more almond milk, if needed, for desired consistency. Serve immediately.

name: Almond Butter & Banana Protein Smoothie
explanation: Almond butter adds nutty flavor plus 7 grams of protein to this healthy, protein-rich banana smoothie.

direction.text: Combine all ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth.

name: Anti-Inflammatory Cherry-Spinach Smoothie
explanation: This healthy smoothie is not only delicious--it also boosts your daily dose of anti-inflammatory foods. It starts with a base of creamy gut-friendly kefir and includes cherries, which can lower the inflammatory marker C-reactive protein. Heart-healthy fats in avocado, almond butter and chia seeds deliver additional anti-inflammatory compounds to the body, while spinach offers a mix of antioxidants that sweep up harmful free radicals. Fresh ginger adds zing, plus a compound called gingerol, which preliminary studies suggest may improve inflammatory markers of heart disease if consumed daily.

ingredients.text: 1 teaspoon chia seeds, plus more for garnish

direction.text: Place kefir in a blender. Add cherries, spinach, avocado, almond butter, ginger and chia seeds; puree until smooth. Pour into a glass; garnish with more chia seeds, if desired.

name: Strawberry-Banana Green Smoothie
explanation: This green smoothie recipe is sweetened only with fruit and gets an extra dose of healthy omega-3s from flaxseeds.

ingredients.text: ½ cup low-fat plain Greek yogurt

direction.text: Puree banana, spinach, yogurt, milk, strawberries and flaxseeds in a blender until smooth.

name: Berry-Mint Kefir Smoothies
explanation: Kefir is similar to yogurt, full of gut-friendly probiotics. But it has fewer carbs and a more drinkable consistency--perfect for smoothies.

direction.text: Combine kefir, berries, juice, mint to taste and honey in a blender. Process until smooth. (The smoothies will keep in the refrigerator for up to 1 day or in the freezer for up to 3 months.)

name: Peanut Butter & Chocolate Banana Smoothie
explanation: Whir up frozen bananas with peanut butter and cocoa in this sweet, creamy drink recipe to get all the delicious flavors of a milkshake with the health benefits of a smoothie.

direction.text: Combine milk, banana, peanut butter, cocoa, chia or hemp seeds (if using) and vanilla in a blender. Puree until smooth

name: Spinach, Peanut Butter & Banana Smoothie
explanation: Peanut butter and banana is a classic combo that's even more delicious with the addition of tangy probiotic-rich kefir. Plus, this peanut butter banana smoothie helps you up your veggie servings for the day with a bit of mild-flavored spinach mixed in.

direction.text: Add kefir, peanut butter, spinach, banana and honey (if using) to a blender. Blend until smooth.

name: Watermelon-Strawberry Smoothie
explanation: Strawberry and watermelon combine in this easy, 4-ingredient healthy fruit smoothie recipe.

direction.text: Combine strawberries, watermelon, yogurt, honey (if using) and lime juice in a blender. Puree until smooth.

name: Raspberry-Kefir Power Smoothie
explanation: Keeping ripe peeled bananas in your freezer means you're always just one step away from a healthy smoothie. Kefir, peanut butter and flaxmeal add protein, probiotics and healthy fats.

ingredients.text: ½ cup raspberries, fresh or frozen

direction.text: Combine banana, raspberries, kefir, peanut butter and flaxmeal in a blender. Process until smooth, adding water a tablespoon at a time, if necessary.

name: Chocolate-Banana Protein Smoothie
explanation: Red lentils give this smoothie a plant-based protein boost. To make this smoothie vegan, try using unsweetened coconut beverage or almond milk in place of the dairy milk.

direction.text: Combine banana, lentils, milk, cocoa and syrup in a blender. Puree until smooth.

name: Pumpkin Pie Smoothie
explanation: This healthy smoothie recipe has all the flavor of a pumpkin spice latte without all the sugar. Made with real pumpkin and frozen banana, this whips into a creamy, luscious grab-&-go breakfast (or snack) in just 5 minutes.

ingredients.text: ½ cup unsweetened almond milk or other nut milk
⅓ cup plain whole-milk Greek yogurt

direction.text: Place banana, almond milk (or other nut milk), yogurt, pumpkin puree, pumpkin pie spice and maple syrup in a blender. Blend until smooth.

name: Mango Raspberry Smoothie
explanation: A squeeze of lemon juice adds bright flavor to this frozen fruit smoothie. Mango provides plenty of sweetness without having to add juice, but if it's too tart for you, a touch of agave will do the trick.

direction.text: Add water, avocado, lemon juice, mango, raspberries and agave (if using) to a blender. Blend until smooth.

name: Watermelon-Mango Smoothie
explanation: This satisfying fruit smoothie recipe has only four ingredients for a quick and easy healthy breakfast on the go.

direction.text: Combine watermelon, mango, banana and yogurt in a blender. Puree until smooth.

name: Berry & Flax Smoothie
explanation: For the prettiest color, use a mixture of berries with a lot of blueberries in this healthy smoothie recipe. Flaxseed oil adds heart-healthy omega-3 fats, making this a serious power smoothie.

direction.text: Blend berries, spinach, yogurt and flaxseed oil in a blender until smooth, stopping to scrape down the sides and stir as needed.

name: Strawberry Peach Smoothie
explanation: Cauliflower in a smoothie might sound like a deal breaker, but trust us, it's worth it. Not only does it boost your veggie servings for the day, it also makes this peach smoothie even creamier.

direction.text: Add apple juice, yogurt, cauliflower rice, strawberries, peaches and sugar (if using) to a blender. Blend until smooth.

name: Coconut Blueberry Smoothie
explanation: Give your blueberry smoothie a tropical update with the rich flavors of coconut milk and coconut cream. Freshly squeezed orange juice lends bright flavor to this healthy smoothie recipe, but if you're short on time, bottled will work just fine.

direction.text: Add coconut milk, orange juice, coconut cream, blueberries and maple syrup (if using) to a blender. Blend until smooth.

name: Cherry Smoothie
explanation: The combination of oat milk, vanilla extract and sweet cherries makes this recipe taste like a cherry pie smoothie. Adding a bit of brown sugar boosts that nostalgia even more.

direction.text: Add oat milk, almond butter, cocoa, vanilla, cherries and sugar (if using) to a blender. Blend until smooth.
